Quotes.text: It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
Quotes.author: The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho

Quotes.text: Anything worth dying for is certainly worth living for.
Quotes.author: Catch-22 by Joseph Heller

Quotes.text: When I discover who I am, I'll be free.
Quotes.author: Invisible Man by Ralph Ellison

Quotes.text: Not all those who wander are lost.
Quotes.author: The Fellowship of the Ring

Quotes.text: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
Quotes.author: Their Eyes Were Watching God by Zora Neale Hurston

Quotes.text: Life is to be lived, not controlled
Quotes.author: Invisible Man by Ralph Ellison

Quotes.text: There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm.
Quotes.author: The Song of the Lark by Willa Cather

Quotes.text: Isn’t it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?
Quotes.author: Anne of Green Gables by  L. M. Montgomery

Quotes.text: Time is the longest distance between two places.
Quotes.author: The Glass Menagerie by Tennessee Williams

Quotes.text: We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.
Quotes.author: The Scarlet Letter by Nathaniel Hawthorne

Quotes.text: Never do tomorrow what you can do today. Procrastination is the thief of time.
Quotes.author: David Copperfield by Charles Dickens,

Quotes.text: So many things are possible just as long as you don’t know they’re impossible.
Quotes.author: The Phantom Tollbooth by Norton Juster

Quotes.text: There is always something left to love.
Quotes.author: One Hundred Years of Solitude by Gabriel García Márquez

Quotes.text: Time moves slowly, but passes quickly.
Quotes.author: The Color Purple by Alice Walker

Quotes.text: And may the odds be ever in your favor.
Quotes.author: The Hunger Games by Suzanne Collins

Quotes.text: All human wisdom is summed up in these two words – Wait and hope.
Quotes.author: The Count of Monte Cristo by Alexandre Dumas

Quotes.text: All the world is made of faith, and trust, and pixie dust.
Quotes.author: Peter Pan by J.M. Barrie

Quotes.text: Life changes in the instant. The ordinary instant.
Quotes.author: The Year of Magical Thinking by Joan Didion

Quotes.text: I have a theory that selflessness and bravery aren’t all that different.
Quotes.author: Divergent by Veronica Roth

Quotes.text: That’s the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet.
Quotes.author: The Namesake byJhumpa Lahiri
